title: Sub Question 1
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

(a) the Sibyl; Deiphobe, guide to Underworld, (priestess); Apollo speaking through Sibyl

(b) Aeneas
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

(a) the Sibyl; Deiphobe, guide to Underworld, (priestess); Apollo speaking through Sibyl

(b) Aeneas

Student response earns one of the available points.

(a) the Sibyl; Deiphobe, guide to Underworld, (priestess); Apollo speaking through Sibyl

(b) Aeneas

Student response earns two of the available points.

(a) the Sibyl; Deiphobe, guide to Underworld, (priestess); Apollo speaking through Sibyl

(b) Aeneas

title: Sub Question 2
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

1 point: munus = golden bough, fetus, “branch, fruit” but not “apple”

1 point: Use = to gain entrance to Underworld

2 points: Needs to refer to Underworld; prefer entry into the Underworld, but by implication the bough also gets him out.

Answer must refer to why Aeneas needs the gift, or how it will help him. For example, student might say it helped him to see his father after Anchises’ death. If student mentions Proserpina, he or she must also mention why she wants/needs the gift.
